required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Weight Variations Impacts on the Ankle of the Child
clinical_study.official_title: Weight Variations Impacts on the Ankle of the Child

lead_sponsor.agency: Delta University for Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Delta University for Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: Obesity is a global health problem. It changes the measurement of the human body and makes a big change to move the body. The increased weight and mass change the way the limbs and whole body generate and react to force Excess fat also interferes with joint-muscle interactions that are important for functional capacity and postural balance The tendency to increase the thickness of the abdomen contributes to anterior movement of the COM of the body. The purpose of the study is to investigate the biomechanical effect of weight on foot stability in children.

primary_outcome.measure: risk of falling in static and dynamic situations for each group
primary_outcome.description: The Biodex Balance System will be used to assess risk of falling

primary_outcome.measure: dynamic level of stability for each group
primary_outcome.description: The Biodex Balance System will be used to assess level of instability

primary_outcome.measure: dynamic Postural stability for each group
primary_outcome.description: The Biodex Balance System will be used to assess Postural stability

primary_outcome.measure: ankle muscles peak and angle specific torque, power and work for each group
primary_outcome.description: Isokinetic dynamometer will be used to assess ankle muscles (plantarflexors, dorsiflexors, inverstors and evertors muscles). it will be assess the peak and angle specific torque, power and work for those muscles.

arm_group.description: Children in this group will be healthy category according to CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) growth chart which ranged from BMI-for-age 5th to 85th percentiles
Children in this group will be overweight category according to CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) growth chart which ranged from BMI-for-age 85th to 95th percentiles .
Children in this group will be obese category according to CDC chart which ranged from BMI-for-age > 95th percentiles
Children in this group will be underweight category according to CDC chart ranged from BMI-for-age < 5th percentiles

study_pop.textblock:
Two hundred healthy non-athletic children from both sexes will participate in this study.
They will randomly be recruited from primary school stage.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Their age will be ranging from 7 to 9 years.
- All children have normal stature for age percentile according to CDC chart.
- The sample will include both sex and will be divided in to 4 groups according to the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention) growth charts
- All children are normal &perform all activities of daily living
- They were able to understand and follow verbal commands and instructions included in the testing procedures.
Exclusion criteria:
- All of them could be part of recreational activities in their public schools but no competitive sports. Children who participated in any regular sport activities involving the lower extremities will be excluded.
- None of them had any surgical intervention in the lower extremities.
- None of them had any history of musculoskeletal deformities or neuromuscular disorders.
- They had neither visual, auditory defect.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Delta University for Science and Technology
responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant. Professor of physical therapy, Department of Physical Therapy for Pediatrics
